description: PGAudit extension configuration for PostgreSQL audit logging

filter_using_role.description: Specifies whether audit logging should be filtered using role-based access control

log.description: Specifies which classes of statements will be logged by session audit logging

log_catalog.description: Specifies that session logging should be enabled in the case where all relations in a statement are in pg_catalog

log_client.description: Specifies whether log messages will be visible to a client process

log_level.description: Specifies the log level that will be used for log entries

log_parameter.description: Specifies that audit logging should include the parameters that were passed with the statement

log_parameter_max_size.description: Sets the maximum size of a parameter value that will be logged

log_relation.description: Specifies whether session audit logging should create a separate log entry for each relation referenced in a SELECT or DML statement

log_statement.description: Specifies whether logging will include the statement text and parameters (if enabled)

log_statement_once.description: Specifies whether logging will include the statement text and parameters (if enabled) with the first log entry for a statement/substatement combination or with every log entry

max_stack_depth.description: Sets the maximum stack depth for audit logging to prevent infinite recursion

object_log.description: Specifies which classes of statements will be logged by object audit logging

object_log_catalog.description: Specifies that object logging should be enabled in the case where all relations in a statement are in pg_catalog

role.description: Specifies the master role to use for object audit logging

session_log_statement_name.description: Specifies whether the statement name, if provided, should be included in the session log
